result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
VOLUNTARY APPEARANCE

Uploaded served warrant document from ShareFile.  No card to pull to send to Sheriff's Department. 

Canceled warrant with Dispatch  10/14/2022 @ 11:53 AM   Deputy Villiard

11:47 AM Defendant Arturo NMI Flores Jr. in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Warrant quashed.   Court addresses DEF on missed appearance, DEF responds.  Court reinstate SIBS $1500.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

1:47 PM Defendant Arturo NMI Flores Jr. not in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Arturo NMI Flores Jr.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Taber indicates recent appointment and no contact.  Court reviews the court record.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Sawyer and Surrounding Counties) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
